	Motor vehicles
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	5 years
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	An appropriate allocation of depreciation expense of property, plant and equipment attributable to manufacturing activities based on normal capacity is capitalized as part of the cost of inventory, and expensed in cost of revenues when the inventory is sold.&#160;&#160;Costs incurred in the construction of property, plant and equipment, including an allocation of interest expense incurred, are capitalized and transferred into their respective asset category when the assets are ready for their intended use, at which time depreciation commences. Ordinary maintenance and repairs are charged to expenses as incurred, while replacements and betterments are capitalized.&#160;&#160;When items are retired or otherwise disposed of, income is charged or credited for the difference between net book value of the item disposed and proceeds realized thereon.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Land Use Rights
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A land use right in the PRC represents an exclusive right to occupy, use and develop a piece of land during the contractual term of the land use right. The cost of a land use right is usually paid in one lump sum at the date the right is granted. The prepayment usually covers the entire period of the land use right. The lump sum advance payment is capitalized and recorded as land use right and then charged to expense on a straight-line basis over the period of the right, which is normally 50 years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Amortization expense of land use rights was US$411,178, US$259,310 and US$224,587 for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, and is included in general and administrative expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(i) Impairment of Long-lived Assets
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Long-lived assets, such as property, plant and equipment, and land use rights, are reviewed for impairment when events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value of such assets may not be recoverable.&#160;&#160;Recoverability of a long-lived asset or asset group to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset or asset group to the estimated undiscounted future cash flows expected to be generated by the asset or asset group.&#160;&#160;If the carrying value of an asset or asset group exceeds its estimated undiscounted future cash flows, an impairment charge is recognized by the amount that the carrying value exceeds the estimated fair value of the asset or asset group.&#160;&#160;Fair value is determined through various valuation techniques including discounted cash flow models, quoted market values and third party independent appraisals, as considered necessary.&#160;&#160;Assets to be disposed are reported at the lower of carrying amount or fair value less costs to sell, and are no longer depreciated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	No impairment of long-lived assets was recognized for any of the years presented.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-11
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage117"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(j) Derivative Financial Instruments
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company recognizes all derivative instruments as either assets or liabilities at their respective fair values. Changes in the fair value of derivative instruments not designated for hedge accounting are recognized in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(k) Revenue Recognition
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company sells its products primarily to approved distributors.&#160;&#160;Revenue is recognized when all of the following conditions are met: persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery of the products has occurred or services have been rendered, the price is fixed or determinable and collectibility is reasonably assured.&#160;&#160;These criteria as they relate to each of the following major revenue generating activities are described below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Products sales
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	For sales in PRC, acceptance of delivery of the products by the distributors is evidenced by goods receipt notes signed by the distributors' customers (or end users). The distributors accept the products at the time they are delivered to the distributors' customers (or end customers).&#160; Delivery acceptance is evidenced&#160;by signed&#160;goods receipt notes.&#160;The Company has no remaining obligations after the distributors' acceptance of the products. Under the terms of the contracts or purchase orders between the Company and the distributors, the risks and rewards of ownership of the products is transferred to the distributor upon the signing of the goods receipt notes and the distributor has no rights to return the products (other than for defective products).&#160;For sales to ROK, delivery of the products occurs at the point in time the product is delivered to the named port of shipment, which is when the risks and rewards of ownership are transferred to the customer.&#160;For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, sales returns were minimal.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The selling price, which is specified in the&#160;sales contracts or purchase orders, is fixed. Under the terms of the sales contract, upon the sale of the products to the distributors and the&#160;signing of the good receipts notes, the Company has the legal enforceable right to receive full payment of the sales price. The distributors' obligation to pay the Company is not dependent on the distributors selling the products or collecting cash from their customers (or end customers).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company's sales are net of value added tax ("VAT") and business tax collected on behalf of tax authorities in respect of product sales. VAT and business tax collected from customers, net of VAT paid for purchases, is recorded as a liability in the consolidated balance sheets until it is paid to the tax authorities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Service revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company used to provide technical assistance and consultation services to manufacturing companies prior to 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Revenue from technical support was recognized as the services were performed, which was evidenced by signed customer acceptance forms on a monthly basis.&#160; Service revenue was recorded, net of business tax and surcharges, which was levied on the Company's service revenues generated in the PRC at the rate of 5.6%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(l) Cost of revenues
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Cost of revenues represents costs of raw materials (including purchasing, receiving and inspection costs), packaging materials, labor, utilities, depreciation and amortization of manufacturing facilities and warehouses, handling costs, outbound freight and inventory write-down.&#160;Depreciation and amortization of manufacturing facilities and warehouses attributable to manufacturing activities is capitalized as part of the cost of inventory, and expensed in costs of revenues when the inventory is sold.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-12
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(m) Selling, general and administrative expenses
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Selling expenses represents primarily costs of payroll, benefits, commissions for sales representatives and advertising expenses.&#160; General and administrative expenses represents primarily payroll and benefits costs for administrative employees, rent and operating costs of office premises, depreciation and amortization of office facilities, and other administrative expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(n) Research and Development Expense
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Research and development costs are expensed as incurred.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(o) Government Grants
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Government grants are recognized when there is reasonable assurance that the Company will comply with the conditions attaching to them and the grants will be received. Government grants for the purpose of giving immediate financial support to the Company with no future related costs are recognized as other income in the Company's consolidated statements of comprehensive income.&#160; Government grants related to the acquisition of assets are recorded as deferred income on the consolidated balance sheets when the grants become receivable, and recognized as other income in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful lives of those assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(p) Income Taxes
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Income taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method.&#160;&#160;Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases and tax operating loss and tax credit carryforwards. Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the periods in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&#160;&#160;The effect of a change in tax rates or tax laws on deferred income tax assets and liabilities is recognized in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income in the period the change in tax rates or tax laws is enacted. A valuation allowance is provided to reduce the carrying amount of deferred income tax assets if it is considered more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred income tax assets will not be realized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company recognizes in the consolidated financial statements the impact of a tax position, if that position is more likely than not of being sustained upon examination, based on the technical merits of the position.&#160;&#160;Recognized income tax positions are measured at the largest amount that is greater than 50% likely of being realized.&#160;&#160;Changes in recognition or measurement are reflected in the period in which the change in judgment occurs.&#160;&#160;The Company has elected to classify interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits, if and when required, as part of interest expense, and general and administration expenses, respectively in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(q) Bills Payable
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Bills payable represent bills issued by financial institutions to the Company's raw material suppliers. The Company's suppliers receive payments from the financial institutions upon maturity of the bills and the Company is obliged to repay the face value of the bills to the financial institutions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-13
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage119"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(r)&#160; Employee Benefit Plans
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Pursuant to relevant PRC regulations, the Company is required to make contributions to various defined contribution plans organized by municipal and provincial PRC governments.&#160;The contributions are made for each PRC employee at rate of approximately 40% on a standard salary base as determined by local social security bureau. Contributions to the defined contribution plans are charged to the consolidated statements of comprehensive income when the related service is provided.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the costs of the Company's contributions to the defined contribution plans amounted to US$1,788,552, US$1,555,471and US1,024,728, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, 77%, 78% and 80% of costs of employee benefits were recorded in general and administration expenses, respectively, with the remaining portion of costs of employee benefits in selling expenses, research and development expenses and cost of revenues each year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company has no other obligation for the payment of employee benefits associated with these plans beyond the contributions described above.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(s) Stock Based Compensation
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company measures the cost of employee services received in exchange for an award of equity instruments based on the grant-date fair value of the award and recognizes the cost over the period during which the employee is required to provide service in exchange for the award, which generally is the vesting period. The amount of cost recognized is adjusted to reflect any expected forfeitures prior to vesting.&#160;&#160;The Company recognizes compensation cost for an award with only service conditions that has a graded vesting schedule on a straight-line basis over the requisite service period for the entire award, provided that the cumulative amount of compensation cost recognized at any date at least equals the portion of the grant-date value of such award that is vested at that date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(t) Commitments and Contingencies
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In the normal course of business, the Company is subject to loss contingencies, such as legal proceedings and claims arising out of its business, that cover a wide range of matters, including, among others, government investigations, shareholder lawsuits, product and environmental liability, and non-income tax matters.&#160;&#160;An accrual for a loss contingency is recognized when it is probable that a liability has been incurred and the amount of loss can be reasonably estimated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(u) Earnings Per Share
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Basic earnings per share ("EPS") is computed by dividing net income attributable to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common stock outstanding during the year using the two-class method.&#160;&#160;Under the two-class method, net income attributable to common stockholders is allocated between common stock and other participating securities based on participating rights in undistributed earnings. Nonvested shares and&#160;redeemable Series D convertible preferred stock are participating securities since the holders of these securities participate in dividends on the same basis as common stockholders.&#160;&#160;Diluted EPS is calculated by dividing net income attributable to common stockholders as adjusted for the effect of dilutive common stock equivalent, if any, by the weighted average number of common stock and dilutive common stock equivalent outstanding during the year.&#160;&#160;Potential dilutive securities are not included in the calculation of diluted earnings per share if the impact is anti-dilutive.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(v) Segment reporting
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company uses the management approach in determining reportable operating segments.&#160;&#160;The management approach consider the internal reporting used by the Company's chief operating decision maker for making operating decisions about the allocation of resources of the segment and the assessment of its performance in determining the Company's reportable operating segments.&#160;Management has determined that the Company has one operating segment, which is the modified plastics segment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-14
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(w) Fair Value Measurements
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company utilizes valuation techniques that maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs to the extent possible. The Company determines fair value based on assumptions that market participants would use in pricing an asset or liability in the principal or most advantageous market. When considering market participant assumptions in fair value measurements, the following fair value hierarchy distinguishes between observable and unobservable inputs, which are categorized in one of the following levels:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="E34D712C0C7446BDB503AC03040DC043" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Level&#160;1
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Inputs:
</FONT>
	Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities accessible to the reporting entity at the measurement date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="CAC6EEA5E1B34A04A0C5CADBC49FAE8D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Level&#160;2
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Inputs
</FONT>
	: Other than quoted prices included in Level&#160;1 inputs that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the asset or liability.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="2F381F7255F44EFE8BD9F141F5D48C49" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Level&#160;3
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Inputs
</FONT>
	: Unobservable inputs for the asset or liability used to measure fair value to the extent that observable inputs are not available, thereby allowing for situations in which there is little, if any, market activity for the asset or liability at measurement date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The level in the fair value hierarchy within which a fair value measurement in its entirety falls is based on the lowest level input that is significant to the fair value measurement in its entirety.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="D6909EBCA2A14E7D88913568BC27871B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of restricted cash and time deposits as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 are categorized as Level 2 measurement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="583AE58C469440859D1A2D99DBF9971A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of foreign currency forward contracts as of December 31, 2014 is categorized as Level 3 measurement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Except for the foreign currency forward contracts, which was measured at fair value on a recurring basis as of December 31, 2014, the Company did not have any financial assets and liabilities or nonfinancial assets and liabilities that are measured and recognized at fair value on a recurring or nonrecurring basis as of December 31, 2015 and 2014.&#160;&#160;Management used the following methods and assumptions to estimate the fair values of financial instruments at the balance sheet dates:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="01427F87306440BF83A9944A7DCB181B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Short-term financial instruments, including cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, time deposits, accounts receivable, amounts due&#160;from a related party, short-term bank loans, bills payable, accounts payable and accrued expenses and other current liabilities- carrying amounts approximate fair values because of the short maturity of these instruments.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="5D3B9A53D406466390321B58B12799D1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Long-term bank loans-fair value is based on the amount of future cash flows associated with each loan discounted at the Company's current borrowing rate for similar debt instruments of comparable terms. The carrying value of the long-term bank loans approximate their fair values as the long-term bank loans carry interest rates which approximate rates currently offered by the Company's banks for similar debt instruments of comparable maturities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="371A9C10EE5147778FD61BE88DF442C2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Notes payable-fair values of the Company's notes payable are estimated based on quoted market prices which are categorized as Level 1 measurement in the fair value hierarchy. As of December 31, 2015, the carrying amount and estimated fair value of the notes payable were US$145,634,996 and US$127,219,500, respectively.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="BEC51DE55C7D4E5E859B4EBE324B2FC8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Derivative liabilities on foreign currency forward contracts- fair values are determined using a discount cash flow model, which discounts the difference between the forward contract exchange rate from the quoted curve and the contract rate multiplied by the notional amounts. It&#160;considers the following significant inputs: risk-free rate and foreign exchange rate.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-15
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	(x) Recently Issued Accounting Standards
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In 2015, the Company elected to early adopt the Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") No. 2015-03,&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Simplifying the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs
</FONT>
	,&#160;which requires the debt issuance costs be presented on the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the carrying amount of the related debt liability, instead of reported on the balance sheet as an asset.&#160; The costs will continue to be amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method.&#160; Upon adoption of the guidance, the debt issuance costs in the amount of US$4,243,412&#160;as of December 31, 2014, which were included in the other non-current assets, have been retrospectively adjusted as a direct deduction of an equivalent amount from the carrying amount of the notes payable as of December 31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In 2015, the Company elected to early adopt the ASU No. 2015-11,&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</FONT>
	,&#160;which changes the measurement principle of inventory from the lower of cost or market to lower of cost and net realizable value, and requires prospective adoption.&#160; Net realizable value is defined as the estimated selling prices in the ordinary course of business, less reasonably predictable costs of completion, disposal and transportation.&#160; The ASU eliminates the guidance that entities consider replacement cost or net realizable value less an approximately normal profit margin when measuring inventory when cost is determined on a first-in-first-out or average cost basis.&#160; The Company applied this new measurement principle of inventory as of December 31, 2015. The adoption of ASU No. 2015-11 did not have any impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In 2015, the Company elected to early adopt the ASU No. 2015-17,&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
	,&#160;which requires entities with a classified balance sheet to present all deferred tax assets and liabilities as noncurrent.&#160; The Company adopted this new guidance retrospectively.&#160; The adoption of ASU No. 2015-17 did not have any impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Financial Accounting Standards Board issued Accounting Standards Codification (&#8220;ASC&#8221;) Topic 842,&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Leases
</FONT>
	, in February 2016. ASC Topic 842 requires a lessee to recognize all leases, including operating leases, on balance sheet via a right-of-use asset and lease liability, unless the lease is a short-term lease (one with an accounting lease term of 12 months or less).&#160; All (or a portion of) fixed payments by the lessee to cover lessor costs related to ownership of the underlying assets, or executory costs, that do not represent payments for a good or service will be considered lease payments and reflected in the measurement of lease assets and lease liabilities by lessees.&#160; The new standard does not substantially change lessor accounting from current U.S. GAAP.&#160; The new standard also requires lessees and lessors to disclose more qualitative and quantitative information about their leases than current U.S. GAAP does.&#160; The standard is applied retrospectively, with elective reliefs.&#160; The new standard is effective for annual and interim reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2018 for a public business entity.&#160; Early adoption is permitted.&#160;&#160; The Company has not yet determined the impact of the new standard on its current policies for leases.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

	182,259,578
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="EA9A14336AD74284860DAD4CD2311A50" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In December 2013, the Company entered into an&#160;equipment purchase contract with Harbin Jiamu Import &amp; Export Trading Co., Ltd ("Jiamu Trading") for a total consideration of RMB1,629.3&#160;million to purchase&#160;70&#160;production lines and RMB89.7 million to purchase testing equipment. In August 2015, the Company signed a supplemental contract with Harbin Jiamu Science and Technology Co., Ltd. (together with Jiamu Trading as "Jiamu") to purchase testing equipment in the amount of RMB16.3 million (equivalent to US$2.5 million). As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company has paid RMB1,608.2 million (equivalent to US$247.2 million) and RMB1,130.9 million (equivalent to US$182.3 million) for production lines and testing equipment, respectively. As of December 31, 2015, the Company has received the equipment of 70&#160;production lines, and hence recorded the related amount from prepayments to construction in progress. The balance of Jiamu as of December 31, 2015 mainly represents the prepayment for testing equipment.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="10EDC115D3204DEA84F52F74EBDD7039" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On January 5, 2015, AL Composites Materials FZE ("AL Composites") entered into an equipment purchase contract with Peaceful Treasure Limited ("Peaceful") for a total consideration of US$271.2 million to purchase certain production and testing equipment. Pursuant to the contract with Peaceful, the Company has paid US$170.0 million as prepayments as of December 31, 2015.
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company's short-term bank loans (including the current portion of long-term bank loans) bear a weighted average interest rate of 4.2% and 5.7% per annum, respectively. All short-term bank loans mature at various times within one year and contain no renewal terms.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In January 2015, the Company obtained a one-year secured loan of US$12.0 million from HSBC Middle East at an annual interest rate of three-month LIBOR (0.6127% as of December 31, 2015) plus 1.8%. These loans were secured by restricted cash of RMB16.5 million (equivalent to US$2.5 million) by the HSBC Bank in Harbin, China. The company repaid this loan on December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In February 2015, the Company obtained a one-year secured loan of US$16.6 million from HSBC Middle East at an annual interest rate of three-month LIBOR (0.6127% as of December 31, 2015) plus 1.8%. These loans were secured by restricted cash of RMB22.8 million (equivalent to US$3.5 million) by the HSBC Bank in Harbin, China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In June 2015, the Company obtained a one-year secured loan of US$7.0 million from Bank of China Luxemburg Branch at an annual interest rate of one-year LIBOR (1.1780% as of December 31, 2015) plus 0.8%. These loans were secured by restricted cash of RMB45.9 million (equivalent to US$7.1 million) by the Bank of China in Harbin, China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In July 2015, the Company obtained a one-year secured loan of US$3.5 million from Bank of China Luxemburg Branch at an annual interest rate of one-year LIBOR (1.1780% as of December 31, 2015) plus 0.75%. These loans were secured by restricted cash of RMB23.0 million (equivalent to US$3.5 million) by the Bank of China in Harbin, China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On September 28, 2015, the company obtained four six-month secured loans of RMB 110 million (equivalent to US$16.9 million) by accounts receivables of RMB170 million (equivalent to US$27.2 million) at an annual interest rate of 4.60% from Harbin Longjiang Bank.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On October 16, 2015, the Company obtained five six-month secured loans of RMB140 million (equivalent to US$21.5 million) by accounts receivables of RMB139.3 million (equivalent to US$21.4 million) at an annual interest rate of 4.60% from Harbin Longjiang Bank.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On December 7, 2015, the Company obtained a six-month secured loan of RMB30 million (equivalent to US$4.6 million) by accounts receivables of RMB39.4 million (equivalent to US$6.1 million) at an annual interest rate of 4.79% from ICBC in Harbin.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	During March and April 2014, the Company obtained two 15-month unsecured loans of RMB50 million at an interest rate of 6.15% per annum from the Bank of Heilongjiang. The Company repaid these loans in advance by the end of March 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

	On December 11, 2014, the Company obtained a two-year unsecured loan of RMB199 million from Bank of Communication at an annual interest rate of 6.60%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On December 16, 2014, the Company obtained a one and a half-year unsecured loan of US$76.4 million from Bank of China Macau Branch at an interest of three-month LIBOR (0.6127% as of December 31, 2015) plus 1.7%.&#160; The interest rate is reset every three months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On June 12, 2014, the Company obtained a three-year secured loan of US$70 million from Bank of China Paris Branch at interest rate of 3-month LIBOR (0.6127% as of December 31, 2015). The loan is secured by restricted cash of RMB 110 million. The Company has repaid US$2 million on June 9, 2015 and US$2 million December 9, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On January 23, 2015, the Company obtained a two-year unsecured loan of RMB100 million (equivalent to US$15.4 million) at an annual interest rate of 6.0% from Agriculture Bank of China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On January 27, 2015, the Company obtained a one and half year secured loan of US$15.2 million from Bank of China Macau Branch, at an interest rate of three-month LIBOR (0. 6127% as of December 31, 2015) plus 1.5%. The interest rate is reset every three months. The loan is secured by restricted cash of RMB100 million (equivalent to US$15.4 million).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On April 22, 2015, the Company obtained a two-year unsecured loan of RMB40 million (equivalent to US$6.1 million) at an annual interest rate of 5.75% from Agriculture Bank of China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

	On July 30, 2015, the Company obtained a thirteen-month unsecured loan of RMB50 million (equivalent to US$7.7 million) at an annual interest rate of 5.25% from Harbin Longjiang Bank.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In October and November, 2015, the Company obtained three five-year unsecured loans of RMB260 million (equivalent to US$40.0 million) at an annual interest rate of 4.75% from Bank of China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company had total lines of credit of RMB4,770.0 million (US$733.2 million) including unused lines of credit of RMB1,822.7 million (US$280.1 million) with remaining terms less than 12 months and RMB398.1 million (US$61.2 million) with remaining terms beyond 12 months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Certain lines of credit contain financial covenants such as total stockholders' equity, debt asset ratio, current ratio, contingent liability ratio and net profit. As of December 31, 2015, the Company has met these financial covenants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-21
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Note 9&#160;&#8211; Notes Payable
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On February 4, 2014, Favor Sea Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, issued US$150,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 11.75% Guaranteed Senior Notes due 2019 (the 'Notes') with issuance price of 99.080%. The Notes bear interest at a rate of 11.75% per annum, payable on February 4 and August 4 of each year, commencing August 4, 2014.&#160;&#160;The Notes will mature on February 4, 2019.&#160;&#160;Net proceeds after debt issuance costs and debt discount were approximately US$143.5 million.&#160;&#160;Debt issuance costs are presented on the consolidated balance sheets as a direct deduction from the carrying amount of notes payable and amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Notes can be redeemed prior to their maturity, the details of which are as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company may at its option redeem the Notes, in whole but not in part, at any time prior to February 4, 2017, at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the Notes redeemed plus the Applicable Premium, as defined in the Indenture of the Notes, and accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to (but not including) the redemption date. In addition, at any time and from time to time prior to February 4, 2017, the Company may at its option redeem up to 35% of the aggregate principal amount of the Notes with the net cash proceeds of one or more sales of common stock of China XD in an equity offering, at a redemption price of 111.75% of the principal amount of the Notes redeemed, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to (but not including) the redemption date, provided that at least 65% of the aggregate principal amount of the Notes issued remains outstanding after each such redemption and any such redemption takes place within 60 days after the closing of the related equity offering.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On or after February 4, 2017, the Company may on any or more occasions redeem all or any part of the Notes, at the redemption prices (expressed as percentages of principal amount) set forth below, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, on the Notes redeemed, to (but not including) the applicable date of redemption, if redeemed during the twelve-month period beginning on February 4 of the years indicated below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Upon occurrence of a Change of Control Triggering Event, as defined in the Indenture of the Notes, the Company must make an offer to purchase all the Notes outstanding at a purchase price equal to 101% of their principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to (but not including) the purchase date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Notes are guaranteed on a senior basis by China XD and Xinda Holding (HK) Company Limited ("Xinda Holding (HK)"), one of its direct subsidiaries. The Notes are secured by a lien on the share capital of Favor Sea Limited and Xinda Holding (HK).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized interest expenses of the Notes in the amount of US$18,710,825 and US$16,870,122, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Unamortized discount and debt issuance costs as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 were US$4,365,004 and US$5,626,355, respectively.
</DIV>
</DIV>

	&#160;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Between August 17, 2014 and August 16, 2016
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Note 12&#8211; Income Taxes
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	China XD and Xinda Holding (HK) US Sub Inc. ("Xinda US)") (collectively referred to as the "U.S. Entities") are each subject to a tax rate of 34% and file separate U.S. federal income tax returns.&#160; Favor Sea (US) Inc. ("Favor Sea (US)") was subject to a tax rate of 34% and file separate U.S. federal income tax returns before all of its assets and liabilities, business and employees were transferred to Xinda US in 2013, as a result of an internal organization.&#160; Favor Sea (US) was liquidated after the reorganization.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Under the current laws of the British Virgin Island ("BVI"), Favor Sea Limited ("Favor Sea BVI"), a subsidiary of China XD, is not subject to tax on its income or capital gains.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	No provision for Hong Kong Profits Tax was made for Xinda Holding (HK) Co., Ltd. ("Xinda HK"), (formerly known as Hong Kong Engineering Plastics Co., Ltd.),&#160;Xinda (HK) International Trading Co., Ltd. ("Xinda Trading", liquidated in February 2015), and Xinda (HK) Trade Company Limited. ("HK Trading") as they did not have any assessable profits arising in or derived from Hong Kong for any of the periods presented.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Under the current laws of Dubai, AL Composites Materials FZE ("Dubai Composites"), a subsidiary of China XD, is exempted from income taxes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company's PRC subsidiaries file separate income tax returns in the PRC.&#160;&#160;Effective from January 1, 2008, the PRC statutory income tax rate is 25% according to the Corporate Income Tax ("CIT") Law which was passed by the National People's Congress on March 16, 2007.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-24
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Pursuant to an approval from the local tax authority in July 2013, Sichuan Xinda Enterprise Group Co., Ltd. ("Sichuan Xinda Group"), a subsidiary of China XD, became a qualified enterprise located in the western region of the PRC, which entitled it to&#160;a preferential income tax rate of 15% from January 1, 2013 to December 31, 2020.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The CIT Law and its implementation rules impose a withholding income tax at 10%, unless reduced by a tax treaty or arrangement, on the amount of dividends distributed by a PRC-resident enterprise to its immediate holding company outside the PRC that are related to earnings accumulated beginning on January 1, 2008. Dividends relating to undistributed earnings generated prior to January 1, 2008 are exempt from such withholding income tax.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	China XD earnings from its subsidiaries in PRC and Dubai are subject to the U.S. federal income tax at 34%, less any applicable foreign tax credits. Due to its plan to indefinitely reinvest its earnings in the PRC, the Company has not provided for deferred income tax liabilities related to PRC withholding&#160;income tax&#160;on undistributed earnings of US$488,303,847 and US$434,416,319 as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. In addition, due to its plan to indefinitely reinvest its earnings in Dubai, the Company has not provided for deferred income tax liabilities related to Dubai on undistributed earnings of US$117,827,046 and US$83,272,307&#160;as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. It is not practicable to estimate the amounts of unrecognized deferred income tax liabilities thereof.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The components of income before income taxes are as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

	The principal components of the Company's deferred income tax assets and deferred income tax liabilities are as follows:

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	16,951,551
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Research Institute was established with a registered capital of approximately US$0.4 million in 2007.&#160;&#160;The Research Institute provided research and development services to the Company's ultimate end customers.&#160;&#160;In December 2010, for tax purposes and because the Research Institute could not meet the Company's development needs, the Company dissolved the Research Institute and formed a new legal entity, Heilongjiang Xinda Enterprise Group Macromolecule Materials R&amp;D Center Company Limited ("Xinda Group Material Research"). Based on applicable regulations promulgated by the local Civil Affairs Bureau, only the local government has the authority for the distribution of the assets of the Research Institute upon liquidation.&#160;&#160;Therefore, the Company dissolved the Research Institute by distributing the net assets of the Research Institute in the amount of US$84.0 million to the local government. The difference between the net assets in the amount of US$84.0 million and&#160;the amount of the initial registered capital of US$0.4 million represents undistributed accumulated profit generated by the Research Institute from its inception date to its liquidation date.&#160;&#160;Simultaneously, the local government granted the net assets back to the Research Center, the newly established subsidiary of Harbin Xinda in December 2010. The Research Center was established with a registered capital of approximately US$0.5 million funded by cash.&#160;&#160;A loss equal to the net assets of the Research Institute distributed to the local government was recognized in other expenses and a government grant for the receipts of the same assets back from the local government was recognized as other income in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income. Pursuant to the local tax regulations, the net assets granted to the Research Center are not subject to income tax to the extent the Research Center spends a total of US$84.0 million in five years from the date of grant.&#160;&#160;The expenditures of US$84.0 million will not be deductible for income tax purposes.&#160;&#160;As a result, the Company recognized a deferred income tax liability in the amount of US$21.5 million in connection with the net assets granted to the Research Center as of December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;To the extent that the Company has spent on research and development equipment during the five years from the date of grant, deferred income tax liabilities relating to the net assets of Research Institute granted to Research Center will be reclassified to deferred income tax liabilities relating to property, plant and equipment, and recognized in profit or loss over the useful life of the asset.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-26
</DIV>
